---
title: "Shield_badge Example"
---

## Basic Usage

Using inline JSON:

{{< shield_badge '{"label": "version", "message": "1.0.0", "color": "blue"}' >}}

{{< shield_badge '{"label": "status", "message": "stable", "color": "green"}' >}}

{{< shield_badge '{"label": "license", "message": "MIT", "color": "orange"}' >}}

## Using Default Values

When properties are omitted, defaults are used:

{{< shield_badge '{"label": "custom"}' >}}

## Spaces in Labels

Spaces in labels and messages are automatically converted to underscores:

{{< shield_badge '{"label": "pull requests", "message": "welcome here", "color": "purple"}' >}}

## Using JSON Files

You can also load badge configuration from JSON files:

{{< shield_badge "badges/python_version.json" >}}
